and my doctor said I might not get any periods at all if it was working.

3_115.speaker: PERSON 1
context: Mixed connective tissue disease? Her ANA is barely elevated!

3_116.utterance: One that fits all the facts. Look, we obviously have a difference of opinion, and that’s fine, but unfortunately I’ve used up all the time I’ve budgeted today for banging my head against a wall.
3_116.speaker: PERSON 1
context: There’s always an explanation, isn’t there?
Yes, there is! And if this one doesn’t work will find another.
But never one involving you screwing up.

3_117.utterance: Oh, right. I forgot how much you care about what people think.
3_117.speaker: PERSON 1
context: Can’t get enough of this place, huh?
Came for my stethoscope.
So, I shouldn’t read too much into the fact that you were looking for it in the drawer with the epinephrine syringes in it?
Okay, yeah. I’d like to clear my reputation.

3_118.speaker: PERSON 4
context: Prescribing cigarettes for inflammatory bowel? It could cause lung cancer, you know.
You know why they have ribbons for breast cancer, colorectal cancer, prostate cancer and not for lung cancer?

3_119.utterance: I’m here because, if I’m right, Cuddy is killing that patient.
3_119.speaker: PERSON 1
context: You’re not here to find your stethoscope. You’re not here to clear your reputation. You’re here because you’re having doubts. You might have screwed up.

3_120.utterance: But she’s always with you in spirit.
3_120.speaker: PERSON 1
context: My Mother's been dead for 10 years

3_121.utterance: The cute one. I think she likes me.
3_121.speaker: PERSON 1
context: What do you know about the nun?
Which one?

3_122.utterance: Do all of you lie? It’s a good strategy, simpler when you all tell the same lie, but she has not spent her entire life as a good Catholic. When she had a cardiac arrest I had to open her blouse to do CPR and I learned two things: nuns can have nice breasts, and she has a tattoo on her shoulder of a skunk.
3_122.speaker: PERSON 1
context: Sister Augustine lived in Catholic foster care until she came to us.
